page.title: 17NURSERY EDUCATION
page.content: There is, in 1985, no State Nursery Education available in Humberston. There are three part-time play-groups which are well supported by local families.There is,however, a growing demand for Nursery Education. The falling rolls situation created some surplus accommodation in the County Infants School. The Education Authority has offered Nursery Training to staff and local teachers have taken advantage of this course. These factors have encouraged parents in their action to bring Nursery Education within reach of Humberston children.In May 1985 a parent's petition was presented to the Education Authority via the School Governing Body, asking for a local Nursery.98 children's names were listed - future pupils who could enjoy the facilities of a Nursery School.
